Any applicable taxes related to Capital One Investing Offers are the responsibility of the account holder. Account holders should consult their tax or legal advisor about the treatment of earnings in IRAs, guidelines on IRS contribution limits, and the appropriate tax treatment for this bonus before accepting the bonus.

HOW THE BONUS WORKS

You have two steps to qualify for your bonus. First, meet with your financial advisor to understand the investing products available. Second, open an account and initiate a new deposit, transfer, and/or rollover (“qualifying transaction”) by #_date:openDate_#. This offer is not valid for clients that have an existing Capital One Investing financial advisor relationship. Transfers from an existing Capital One Investing account, or from a Capital One Bank IRA, do not qualify. Your bonus will be based on the net qualifying assets in the account #_decimal:calendarDays_# days after the initial qualifying transaction. Net qualifying assets are the total amounts of your deposits, transfers and rollovers, minus any withdrawals. Net qualifying assets are calculated at the account level. (Note: the qualifying asset amount isn’t affected by any change in value for your securities after they are deposited.) Valid for individual, joint, and custodial accounts and traditional and Roth IRAs. Promotion is not valid for 529 Plans, Trusts, Education Savings Accounts (“ESAs”), Government, or other Business/Corporate accounts. Limit one offer per account (multiple accounts may qualify). Bonus will be awarded to your Capital One Investing brokerage account within #_string:bonusTime_# following the #_decimal:calendarDays_#-day period. Bonus may be refused if it is determined that you violated Capital One Investing’s Account Agreement.

HOW TO ACCESS YOUR BONUS

For Capital One Managed Portfolio accounts, your bonus will be deposited into the qualifying account and reinvested into your portfolio. For other eligible accounts, if you have a bank account linked to your Capital One Investing account, your bonus will be automatically deposited into the linked bank account. If there is not a linked bank account, your bonus will be deposited as cash into the qualifying brokerage account.

HOW THE BONUS WORKS

You have two steps to qualify for your cash bonus. First, enter promo code #_string:promoCode_# for new online accounts, or #_string:promoCodeExisting_# for existing online accounts, by the promotion expiration date: #_date:openDate_#. Second, deposit, transfer or roll over assets to that account. Assets must post to that account within #_decimal:calendarDays_# days of entering the code. Your net qualifying assets posted during that #_decimal:calendarDays_#-day period must be at least $#_decimal:depositAmount1_# to be eligible for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount1_# bonus; $#_decimal:depositAmount2_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount2_# bonus; $#_decimal:depositAmount3_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount3_# bonus; or $#_decimal:depositAmount4_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount4_# bonus. If your net qualifying assets are within $100 of a higher bonus level, you will be credited at that level so you receive a larger bonus. Your net qualifying assets are the total amounts of your deposits, transfers and rollovers, minus any withdrawals. (Note: the qualifying asset amount isn't affected by any change in value for your securities after they were deposited.) Transfers from an existing online Capital One Investing, LLC, account, or from a Capital One 360® IRA to an online Capital One Investing IRA, do not qualify. Valid for IRAs and Individual, Joint or Custodial accounts only. Promotion is non-transferable and not valid for ESAs. Net qualifying assets only count towards one offer. If you previously qualified for a similar offer in any of your Capital One Investing accounts, you are not eligible to enroll in this offer for #_decimal:leastMonths_# months after the date you enrolled in the previous offer.

WHEN YOU GET YOUR BONUS

Bonus will be awarded to your account within #_string:bonusTime_# following the #_decimal:calendarDays_#-day period. Bonus is not available for withdrawal for #_decimal:withdrawalDays_# days after it is awarded. Qualifying assets must remain in the account (minus any losses related to trading or market volatility) for at least #_decimal:leastMonths2_# months following the #_decimal:calendarDays_#-day period or your bonus may be reclaimed. Bonus may be refused or recovered if it is determined that you violated Capital One Investing's Account Agreement.

TAXES & YOUR BONUS

Any applicable taxes related to Capital One Investing Offers are the responsibility of the account holder. To the extent required by law, Capital One will report the total value of the bonus with respect to a non-IRA investment account to the IRS on Form 1099-INT for the applicable tax year in which it is paid. Account holders should consult a tax or legal advisor to determine the appropriate tax treatment of this bonus for tax purposes.

For traditional and Roth IRAs, the bonus is a cash award that will be deposited directly into the account holder's IRA and treated the same as investment earnings in the account. The bonus will not be reported to the IRS as an IRA contribution and will be reported when distributed on Form 1099-R the same as the remainder of your IRA balance. Account holders should consult their tax or legal advisor about the treatment of earnings in IRAs, guidelines on IRS contribution limits, and the appropriate tax treatment for this bonus before accepting the bonus.

Transfers from an existing Capital One Investing account, or from a CAPITAL ONE BANK IRA TO CAPITAL ONE INVESTING IRA, DO NOT QUALIFY. Your net qualifying assets funded during the 60-day period in any one account must be at least $#_decimal:depositAmount1_# to be eligible for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount1_# bonus; $#_decimal:depositAmount2_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount2_# bonus; $#_decimal:depositAmount3_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount3_# bonus; or $#_decimal:depositAmount4_# for a $#_decimal:bonusAmount4_# bonus. . If your net qualifying assets are within $100 of a higher bonus level, you will be credited at that level so you receive a larger bonus.

WHEN YOU GET YOUR BONUS

Bonus will be awarded to your Capital One Investing brokerage account within 4-6 weeks following the 60-day period. Bonus may be refused if it is determined that you violated Capital One Investing’s Account Agreement.

TAXES & YOUR BONUS

Any applicable taxes related to Capital One Investing Offers are the responsibility of the account holder. To the extent required by law, Capital One will report the total value of the bonus with respect to a non-IRA investment account to the IRS on Form 1099-INT for the applicable tax year in which it is paid. Account holders should consult a tax or legal advisor to determine the appropriate tax treatment of this bonus for tax purposes.

For traditional and Roth IRAs, the bonus is a cash award that will be deposited directly into the account holder's IRA and treated the same as investment earnings in the account. The bonus will not be reported to the IRS as an IRA contribution and will be reported when distributed on Form 1099-R the same as the remainder of your IRA balance. Account holders should consult their tax or legal advisor about the treatment of earnings in IRAs, guidelines on IRS contribution limits, and the appropriate tax treatment for this bonus before accepting the bonus.

TAXES & YOUR BONUS

If you have a Bank account linked to your Capital One Investing account, your bonus may be automatically deposited into the linked Bank account. Otherwise, call (800)-248-3919 and select option 2 to request that your bonus be transferred from your Capital One Investing account via personal check. If you take a distribution from your IRA, the amount withdrawn (including any earnings) will be reported on an IRS Form 1099-R to you and the IRS. Please consult your tax or legal advisor prior to signing a distribution form.

Target Date Funds: These funds are investments in securities that attempt to rebalance asset allocations according to a particular time horizon generally becoming more conservative as the fund's target year is reached. Investment in these types of funds does not guarantee against losses or that a particular return at the target date will be achieved as factors such as investment amount or savings rate are not considered. Individual risk tolerance is not considered and the underlying assets such as mutual funds and exchange-traded funds may carry additional risks due to the assets held in those underlying portfolios. These types of funds are not suitable for all investors. You should carefully review the fund's prospectus for specific fund risks, objectives, and expenses before investing. Due to the active management and underlying investments, these funds may carry more ongoing costs than other assets.

Winner of three Stevie® Awards from both the 2013 and 2014 American Business Awards (ABA): one of multiple recipients of a Bronze Stevie in 2013 and a Silver Stevie in 2014 for Customer Service Department of the Year - Financial Services and single recipient of a Gold Stevie for Customer Service Executive of the Year in 2014; and the single recipient of the Gold Stevie for Customer Service Team of the Year - Financial Services or Insurance in 2013 and 2014. One of over 3200 entrants across all categories in both 2013 and 2014 that submitted an essay detailing accomplishments since January 1, 2013, as well as a biography of the leader of the department or team being considered for an award. Winners were determined by two independent reviews conducted by ABA Stevie Awards staff approved volunteer judges in April and May of both 2013 and 2014. At least five judges participated in the first round and members of specialized committees judged the second round. First round judges assigned ratings to entrants in each category using a scale of 1-10. Entrants with scores of at least 7.0 were deemed Finalists, and were rated by the second round judges. The Finalist with the highest score in each category received the Gold Stevie. Finalists in each category with an average score of at least 8.0 received a Silver Stevie and all other Finalists in each category received a Bronze Stevie.

disclaimer.name: calculatedCashSweep
disclaimer.title: How are the Cash Sweep Programs calculated?

root.disclaimer:
How are the Cash Sweep Programs calculated?

The Money Market Fund pays dividends, not interest, and any accumulated dividends post to your account once a month. If less than $0.000005 of dividends is accrued in a given day, the amount will be rounded down to $0 and, therefore, you will not accrue dividends for that day.

Please make sure to view the Money Market Fund's prospectus for additional details. The Money Market Fund publishes a 7-day yield. This takes into account the interest paid—less expenses for the fund for the last 7 days. The published yield is not compounded. Performance Data represents past performance and does not guarantee future results. The fund's most recent 7-day yield may be lower or higher than the figure quoted above. Yield and return may vary.

The FDIC Insured Cash Balance pays interest and it is accrued daily and posted monthly. If less than $0.000005 of interest is accrued in a given day, the amount will be rounded down to $0 and, therefore, you will not accrue interest for that day.

The FDIC Cash Balance has a rate of return calculated as an APY or Annual Percentage Yield. It is the annualized rate of return that has taken compounding into effect. The rate of the APY (effective 05/01/2015) may vary.

disclaimer.name: insuredCashSweep
disclaimer.title: How are the Cash Sweep Programs insured?

root.disclaimer:
How are the Cash Sweep Programs insured? The FDIC Insured Cash Balance is a deposit in a bank and the value is eligible for FDIC insurance. The FDIC Insured Cash Balance will be eligible for FDIC insurance up to $250,000 (including interest and principal) per depositor for all aggregated accounts. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) is an independent agency of the United States government that protects the funds depositors place in banks and savings associations. FDIC insurance is backed by the full faith and credit of the United States government.

Investment in the Money Market Fund is not a deposit in a bank, and is not insured or guaranteed by the FDIC. Investment in the Money Market Fund is covered by the Securities Investor Protection Corporation (SIPC), which protects customers of member firms when their stocks, money or other securities are stolen or put into jeopardy by the brokerage. Capital One Investing, LLC, is a member of SIPC. SIPC provides a maximum claim of $500,000 for each customer of which $250,000 is allocated as a maximum claim for cash. For more information, www.sipc.org.

Important information about the FDIC Insured Cash Balance:
The FDIC Insured Cash Balance is held at Capital One, N.A., Member FDIC. The FDIC Insured Cash Balance will be eligible for FDIC insurance up to $250,000 (including interest and principal) per depositor for all aggregated deposits held at Capital One, N.A.

root.disclaimer:
HOW THE BONUS WORKS

You have two steps to qualify for your cash bonus. First, open a new or fund an existing online Individual Retirement Account (IRA), Individual, Joint or Custodial account using promo code [CODE] for new accounts, or [CODE] for existing accounts by the promotion expiration date: [MM/DD/YYYY]. You must have a U.S. Tax I.D. (Social Security number) to open a Capital One Investing, LLC, account. Second, make a net deposit, transfer, and/or rollover that posts to your account within [XX] days after entering the promo code. Your net qualifying assets posted during that [XX]-day period must be at least $[DOLLARAMT] to be eligible for a $[DOLLARAMT] bonus, $[DOLLARAMT] for a $[DOLLARAMT] bonus, $[DOLLARAMT] for a $[DOLLARAMT] bonus, $[DOLLARAMT] for a $[DOLLARAMT] bonus, or $[DOLLARAMT] for a $[DOLLARAMT] bonus. If your net qualifying assets are within $100 of a higher bonus level, you will be credited at that level so you receive a larger bonus. Your net qualifying assets are the total amounts of your deposits and transfers, minus any withdrawals. (Note: the qualifying asset amount isn't affected by any change in value for your securities after they were deposited.) Transfers from an existing online Capital One Investing account, or from a Capital One 360® IRA to an online Capital One Investing IRA, do not qualify. Promotion is non-transferable, not valid for ESAs, and not valid with any other promotion. Limit one bonus per customer or custodial beneficiary.

WHEN YOU GET YOUR BONUS

Capital One Investing will add the bonus to your account within [5–7 business days or 4–6 weeks] following the [XX]-day period. The bonus is not available for withdrawal for [XX] days after it is awarded to your account. Qualifying assets must remain in the account (minus any losses related to trading or market volatility) for at least [YY] months following the [XX]-day period or your bonus may be reclaimed. Bonus may be refused or recovered if it is determined that you violated Capital One Investing's Account Agreement.

TAXES & YOUR BONUS

Any taxes related to Capital One Investing offers are your responsibility. The bonus is a cash award and will not be reported to the IRS as an IRA contribution.
